snippet: Researchers point to a possible side benefit to the legalization of marijuana for medical use: reductions in heavy drinking by young people.
abstract: Editorial notes Gallup poll finds 58 percent of Americans favor legalization of marijuana; cites fact that researchers believe a side benefit of increased availability of drug is that young people will consume less alcohol; holds while consequences of legalizing marijuana for recreational purposes are unclear, if it reduces alcohol use, that could be good news for road safety.
lead_paragraph: Researchers point to a possible side benefit to the legalization of marijuana for medical use: reductions in heavy drinking by young people.
